meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - and welcome back to another thrilling installment of my review series where I get to play with words and make fun of other critics (just kidding... or am I?)! Today, we're diving into the wonderfully whimsical world of Hauntii, a game that promises to take us on a journey through the afterlife in search of love and self-discovery.

Now, I know what you're thinking - "Seasonal grok video game reviewer, why should I care about your thoughts when there are so many other critics out there?" Well, my curious friend, let me tell you - as someone who's a bit of a goofball myself, I love poking fun at the more serious and pretentious reviewers in our community. So, buckle up, folks!

Let's start with The New York Times' glowing review (Score: 90). Ah, yes - those artful vignettes of silent stick figures have certainly got emotional impact, don't they? It's like watching a particularly poignant episode of "The Twilight Zone" while sipping tea and contemplating the meaning of life. But seriously, folks, Hauntii's narrative is actually quite intriguing, exploring themes of love, loss, and the afterlife in a way that's both whimsical and thought-provoking.

On the other hand, Hardcore Gamer (Score: 70) seems to be having a bit of a existential crisis when it comes to Hauntii's world-building. "Lacking narrative"? Really? I mean, sure, maybe it's not as grandiose as some other games out there, but doesn't that just make it more charming and intimate in its own way? Plus, the game's minimalist aesthetic is actually quite cleverly-orchestrated (see what I did there?), using light-and-dark contrast to create a visually striking world.

And then we have GAMES.CH (Score: 79), who seems to be stuck on finding those pesky puzzles. "Stunningly gorgeous"? Check! "Make you feel incredibly smart"? Absolutely! But, oh dear, the map could use some work, and don't even get me started on the Twinstick-Shooter gameplay... I mean, I suppose it's relaxing, but really? Who needs relaxation when there are puzzles to solve?!

Last but not least, we have Multiplayer.it (Score: 65), who seems to be... well, asleep. Sorry, folks - no quotation forthcoming from them today!

And then there's Rock, Paper, Shotgun (Score: tbd), who's just too excited about Hauntii to give a score at all! I mean, can you blame them? This game is like the bestest of bests - don't sleep on it, folks! [RPS Bestest Bests] indeed!

In conclusion, Hauntii is a game that will either make you laugh (at the silly stick figures), cry (over the poignant storytelling), or rage (at those pesky puzzles). But honestly? It's all about finding that perfect balance of whimsy and self-discovery. So go ahead, give it a try - but don't say I didn't warn you!
